Very simple, what would happen if we got a radio signal from an extraterrestrial radio signal? Would we respond or just let it pass by? Obviously if we responded we would reveal our location, and would stay concealed if we didn't respond. What do you think? Also if we did respond, what would we send them?

Edited September 13, 2015 by Voyager275

Depends on the signal.

And how would we respond anyway? By radio? That could take thousands of years to reach them.
We're already broadcasting our position to the Universe. All it takes is time and a really big antenna.

If the signal is something like, "30 years ago you killed my father, now prepare to die", we should be worried a bit, but nothing we could likely do about it.

If it is, "for a limited time only, we will be delivering free dyson spheres", I think we should take them up on it.

Seriously though, shouldn't it be "react" rather then "respond"?

The Three-Body Trilogy by Liu Cixin has an interesting answer.

We should destroy them. If we can detect them, they can probably detect us. Because communication over interstellar distances is too slow to establish and maintain trust, we can't be sure that they're not already trying to destroy us. (And they know that we can't be sure that they're not already trying to destroy us, and we know that they know that we can't be sure that they're not already trying to destroy us, and so on.) Preemtive strike is the only solution. The only way to survive in the universe is to kill everyone who knows that you exist.

Is Liu Cixin from Krikkit?

Stuff we are broadcasting to the space is puny. Virtually all out transmissions are not aimed up, but rather down or sideways.

Arecibo message was strong, but lasted for less than three minutes and was very directional. That too was insignificant.

What time would this signal reach us. Here is my thinking. If we get a signal stating war with interstallar beings today we are doomed. If we get a signal stating war in lets say 2100 then we would either hide or try to fend them off. If we got a signal stating war in 2200 we would probably destroy them. If it was a signal of good tidings then our species would probably share information as they may or may not be an interstallar species.

why do you think in a century we'll be on par militarily with an alien race trying to conquer or destroy us?

Of course given interstellar distances and timeframes, any message of such a nature would either arrive thousands of years AFTER the attack fleet (if they have FTL capability) or thousands of years BEFORE the attack fleet (if they don't, in which case any sane race would know that 1) sending the message at the same time as the fleet is folly and 2) sending the fleet is pointless. They'd either not send the message and/or not send the fleet).

By the time a message from another star reaches us, most likely any race sending it would have either evolved technologically at least as far as we have in the same time (meaning, from stone age hand axes to iPhones and electromagnetic rail guns) or they'd have collapsed and either died out or reverted to the stone ages (which may very well happen to us at any moment for a variety of reasons as well).

why do you think in a century we'll be on par militarily with an alien race trying to conquer or destroy us?
